document_data.name: Xaxan Thavish
document_data.languages: [[Common]], [[Draconic language|Draconic]], [[Dwarvish]], [[Elven language|Elvish]]{{Cite adventurers league/Foulness Beneath Mulmaster|19}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Xaxan Thavish''' was a member of the [[Cult of the Eternal Flame]] in [[Mulmaster]].
document_data.Personality: The priest was a vain and fastidious sociopath. He tried to keep himself always immaculately clean. While Xaxan presented a friendly facade, he was full of envy and resentment. He greatly disliked water cultists. He was a notorious womanizer.
document_data.Relationships: Xaxan was a cleric affiliated with the Cult of the Eternal Flame. He had a sexual relationship with the wife of his superior until the latter found out.
document_data.Possessions: The cultist wielded a [[quarterstaff]] in battle.
document_data.History:
In [[1491 DR]], after being discovered having sex with his superior's wife, Xaxan's superior offered him two options—become a [[flameskull]] or join an expedition into the [[sewers of Mulmaster]] sponsored by the [[Cult of the Crushing Wave]]. Xaxan chose the latter and was sent to find the tomb of an ancient [[kuo-toa]] mystic devoted to [[Olhydra]] and [[Bwimb]].{{Cite adventurers league/Foulness Beneath Mulmaster|5}} However, a band of [[troglodyte]]s attacked their camp, killing the leader of expedition, a warrior named [[Vyrlo Trath]], and this left Xaxan as the highest-ranking member present.

At last, an adventuring party hired to investigate the body of a [[flumph]],{{Cite adventurers league/Foulness Beneath Mulmaster|10}} which Xaxan had earlier killed, found and confronted him.
